title: PantryPal: Revolutionizing Food Management
content:
Welcome to **PantryPal**, an application designed to make managing your groceries and meals effortless and magical.

Our core mission is to leverage **Artificial Intelligence** to transform everyday kitchen tasks:

*   **Simplify inventory tracking**
*   **Generate personalized meal ideas**
*   **Provide proactive insights** to reduce food waste

This presentation will walk you through PantryPal's complete functionalities, highlighting the AI enhancements that power each feature.

title: F1: AI-Powered Inventory Ingestion
content:
### Goal: Make adding groceries effortless and magical.

### User Goal:
"*I just came back from the store. I want to add all my groceries to the app in less than a minute.*"

### AI Enhancement:

*   Utilizes **Optical Character Recognition (OCR)** on grocery receipts.
*   Employs **Image Recognition** for fresh produce (not detailed in pipeline, but mentioned in 1.1).

This functionality streamlines the initial step of populating your digital pantry.

title: F1: User Interface for Inventory Ingestion
content:
### Easy Access Input:

*   The user taps a large **"+" button** on the home screen.

### Presented with three clear options for adding items:

1.  **Scan Receipt:**
    *   AI-powered "wow" feature.
    *   Fastest way to add multiple items from a grocery trip.
2.  **Scan Barcode:**
    *   Quick single-item entry.
    *   Ideal for individual items or small additions.
3.  **Add Manually:**
    *   Reliable fallback for any item not covered by other methods.

This intuitive interface ensures all users can easily add items.

title: F1: Scan Receipt - The Full Pipeline
content:
### Flutter Frontend:

*   **Camera Activation:** Opens the phone's camera for the user.
*   **Photo Capture:** User takes a clear, well-lit photo of the grocery receipt.
*   **Image Preparation:** The image is compressed for efficient data transfer.
*   **Backend Transmission:** The prepared image is sent to the backend for AI processing.

### Return to Frontend:

*   Backend returns a structured list of identified items.
*   UI displays a confirmation screen: "*We found these 15 items. Please review.*"
*   User corrects any mistakes, then taps "Confirm" to add all items to their digital pantry.

title: F1: Scan Receipt - Backend AI Processing
content:
### Behind the Scenes Intelligence:

1.  **OCR Service:**
    *   Processes the receipt image using an OCR model (e.g., Google Cloud Vision or a fine-tuned open-source model).
    *   Extracts **all text** from the receipt.

2.  **Text Parsing & Structuring:**
    *   A custom AI script or **LLM** (e.g., GPT-4) parses the extracted text.
    *   Identifies **items, quantities, and prices**.
    *   Removes irrelevant data (e.g., store name, tax).

3.  **Product Matching:**
    *   Parsed items are matched against a comprehensive **food database**.
    *   Standardizes product names, categories, and assigns default shelf-life estimates.

title: F2: Dynamic Recipe & Meal Plan Generation
content:
### Goal: Provide personalized meal ideas based on available ingredients.

### User Goal:
"*It's 6 PM. I'm tired and uninspired. Show me a simple, healthy recipe I can make right now with the ingredients I have, especially using the chicken that expires tomorrow.*"

### AI Enhancement:

*   Uses a **fine-tuned Large Language Model (LLM)**.
*   Generates **unique and personalized recipes**.
*   Goes beyond simple database matching to create truly tailored suggestions.

This functionality turns your pantry into a personal chef.

title: F2: Recipe Generation Pipeline
content:
### User Interface (UI):

*   **Button:** "Generate a Recipe"
*   **Optional Filters:** "Quick (under 30 mins)", "Healthy", "Vegan", or natural language input.

### Backend (AI Processing):

1.  **Prepare the Prompt:**
    *   Constructs a detailed prompt for the LLM, including:
        *   Available ingredients (with expiry info).
        *   User preferences.
        *   Output format requirements.
2.  **LLM Generation:**
    *   Prompt is sent to a powerful LLM (e.g., GPT-4 or Gemini).
    *   The LLM generates a unique, easy-to-follow recipe.
3.  **Structure the Output:**
    *   Response is formatted as JSON (e.g., `recipeName`, `ingredientsList`, `instructions`, `cookTime`).

### Return to Frontend:

*   Display recipe in a clean layout.
*   User can tap "I made this!", triggering automatic ingredient deduction from inventory.

title: F3: The "PantryPal" AI Assistant (Chatbot)
content:
### Goal: Enable full conversational control of the app.

### User Goal:
"*I don't want to tap through menus. I just want to ask questions and get answers.*"

### AI Enhancement:

*   A **conversational chatbot** capable of understanding intent.
*   Executes functions such as inventory checking, recipe generation, or adding to the shopping list.

### Full Pipeline:

*   **UI:** A chat icon is always visible, opening a familiar conversational interface.
*   **Backend (Intent Recognition):** User query analyzed via intent recognition or LLM function-calling (e.g., "*Do I have any eggs left?*" → check_inventory).
*   **Action & Response Generation:** Executes the identified action and provides a text response or rich embedded card (e.g., full recipe).

title: F4: Proactive & Actionable Expiration Alerts
content:
### Goal: Turn expiring food notifications into valuable, actionable insights.

### User Goal:
"*Remind me before food expires and show me an easy way to use it.*"

### AI Enhancement:

*   Generates **contextual alerts** that go beyond simple notifications.
*   **Suggests recipes** to use expiring items.
*   **Intelligent Bundling:** Combines multiple expiring items for joint recipe ideas (e.g., "*Your chicken and bell peppers are expiring soon! Perfect for Chicken Fajitas.* ")

This functionality proactively helps users reduce food waste and save money.

title: F4: Expiration Alerts Pipeline - The Solution Loop
content:
This pipeline transforms a basic alert into an intelligent loop from **problem (expiring food)** to **solution (ready-to-make recipe)** in one seamless user interaction.

### 1. The Background Task (The Watcher):
*   A scheduled task runs daily (e.g., 8 AM).
*   Scans inventory for items expiring within 1-3 days.
*   Produces a list of expiring items with user IDs.

### 2. AI-Powered Suggestion Generation (The Brain):
*   An LLM crafts a short push notification, a simple recipe title, and identifies the target item(s).
*   Tone is friendly and helpful.

### 3. Sending the Push Notification:
*   Backend sends notification via Firebase or Apple Push Service.
*   Includes hidden metadata with the suggested recipe title.

### 4. The In-App Experience:
*   User taps the notification → app opens.
*   Metadata triggers Functionality 2 (Recipe Generation) using the suggested recipe.
*   The full recipe appears instantly, ready for the user to cook!
